name: Servicenow
description: This app provides ServiceNow integration for tickets and records

url.description: Device URL including the port, e.g. https://myservicenow.enterprise.com:8080

client_id.description: Client ID. OAuth will be preferred if provided

client_secret.description: Client Secret. Required with Client ID

actions.description: Run a query on the device to test connection and credentials

actions.verbose: If table value is not specified, the action defaults to incident. If max_results value is not specified, the action defaults to 100.

max_results.description: Max number of records to return

vault_id.description: Vault ID of file to attach to ticket

actions.verbose:
Create a new ticket with the given short_description and description. Additional values can be specified in the fields parameter. Study the results of the get ticket action to get more info about all the properties that can be added. The JSON that is specified in the fields parameter should have the keys and values specified in double quotes string format, except in case of boolean values, which should be either true or false (without any single quote) for example: {"short_description": "Zeus, multiple action need to be taken", "made_sla": false}.
If this action is performed from the playbook the easiest thing to do is create a dictionary (for e.g. my_fields_value_dict) and then pass the return value of json.dumps(my_fields_value_dict) as the value of fields. Please see the servicenow_app playbook for an example.
One can specify a table other than incident to create the ticket in. Do note that the fields for user generated tables, usually are named with a u_ prefix. In such cases it is better to use the fields parameter to set values.
ServiceNow restricts the time taken and the file size of attached files, because of which file uploads might fail. These values can be configured by an admin on the ServiceNow device. As of this writing, please go to this link on the ServiceNow Website for more information.
If table value is not specified, the action defaults to incident.
ServiceNow does not return an error if an invalid field is updated, or if a valid field is updated in an invalid manner, for e.g. updating the caller_id dictionary with your own dictionary. For best results, please check the results of the action in JSON view to verify the changes.
If table value is not specified, the action defaults to incident.

vault_id.description: Vault ID of file to attach to ticket

actions.verbose:
Update an already existing ticket with the values that are specified in the fields parameter. The user has to know the key names to set in this parameter. Study the results of the get ticket action to get more info about all the properties that can be updated. The JSON that is specified in the 'fields' parameter should have the keys and values specified in double quotes string format, except in case of boolean values, which should be either 'true' or 'false' (without the single quotes) for example: {"short_description": "Zeus, multiple action need to be taken", "made_sla": false}
The action first attemps to update the ticket with the values in fields. If this call is successful, it continues to attach the file specified in vault_id. These are two separate calls made to ServiceNow.
ServiceNow restricts the time taken and the file size of attached files, because of which file uploads (of attachments) might fail. These values can be configured by an admin on the ServiceNow device. As of this writing, please go to this link on the ServiceNow Website for more information.
If table value is not specified, the action defaults to incident.
ServiceNow does not return an error if an invalid field is updated, or if a valid field is updated in an invalid manner, for e.g. updating the caller_id dictionary with your own dictionary. For best results, please check the results of the action in JSON view to verify the changes.
